Description.val:
The Department decided that a number of survivability improvements needed to be incorporated into mission-essential ship and combat systems during their acquisition and modernization. Shipboard fires have emphasized the urgent need to upgrade features and design standards that contribute to survivability.

[P40A / HB003 - EMERGENCY ESCAPE BREATHING DEVICE (EEBD)]: Emergency Escape Breathing Device (EEBD) breathing apparatus for firefighters are reaching their service life of 15 years and must be replaced.  EEBDs address a high priority CNO effort to replace expired breathing equipment aboard ships throughout the Fleet.  The requirement for this capability has been validated by the experience of numerous shipboard casualties.  EEBD replacement is required to ensure that ships will deploy with operational safety equipment on-board to allow for emergency escape from shipboard fires.

[P40A / HB830 - PRODUCTION ENGINEERING (PE)]: PE includes development of technical manuals, Planned Maintenance System (PMS), Provisioning Technical Documentation (PTD), Program Support Data (PSD) and Allowance Parts List (APLs), engineering to manage procurement and material support of design reviews, and program management

[P3A / HB002 - MAGAZINE SPRINKLING IMPROVEMENT]: Replaces the detection system designed in the 1960s which has performance deficiencies and is difficult to support and maintain.  Replacement includes the Fire Detection and Actuation System (FDAS) and the Motor-Operated Pilot Valves (MOPV).  When the FDAS detects a fire, the MOPV opens to provide the sprinkling for the magazine.  The FDAS consists of heat detectors, smoke detectors for amphibious ships, and associated controls.  MOPV is the same item procured under HB007 - SOPV Replacement.  FDAS/MOPV provides increased fire performance and reduced lifecycle and logistics costs.

[P3A - 2 / HB007 - SOPV REPLACEMENT]: The Solenoid Operated Pilot Valve (SOPV) provides a way for remote control of the Aqueous Film Forming Foam (AFFF) and Countermeasure Wash Down (CMWD) systems.  Existing SOPVs are unreliable, costly to repair, and produce the longest downtime for the AFFF system.  Top Management Attention/Top Management Initiative (TMA/TMI) and INSURV interest due to impact of this item on AFFF system operation.  Replacement of the SOPV with the Motor Operated Pilot Valve (MOPV) is required to ensure these systems are operational for emergencies.  MOPV has a 50 year service life and will provide a significant reduction in preventative maintenance and cost.

[P3A - 3 / HB008 - SCBA REPLACEMENT]: Self-Contained Breathing Apparatus (SCBA) is a compressed air breathing device compatible with a firefighter's protective wear and helmet, and other damage control equipment.  The SCBA are reaching the end of their service life of 15 years and are being replaced with 30 year cylinders.  SCBA replacement is required to ensure that ships will deploy with operational safety equipment on-board to provide breathable air while fighting shipboard fires.

Name.@footnote: The P40 unit costs are identified as costs per ship for EEBD.  Unit costs can vary based on the distribution of ship classes planned during each FY, quantities per ship class, and the ship port location. Requirement is for CG-47, DDG-51 (Flight I, II, IIA), LCS-1, LCS-2, LHD-1, LSD-41, LSD-49, MCM-1, and PC-1 ship classes.   PROCUREMENT: Funding includes the breathing apparatus, shipping, and distribution to ships.  There are no EEBD procurements scheduled for FY2020. FY2021 procurement includes one (1) LPD 0017 class ship (total $0.518M), six (6) DDG 0051 Flight IIA class ships (average $0.193M), and (1) LCS 0001 class ship (total $0.040M) for a program total of $1.716M.  FY2022 procurement includes three (3) DDG 0051 Flight IIA (average $0.197M) and one (1) LCS 0002 class ship (total $0.040M) for a program total of $0.631M.  FY2023 procurement includes one (1) LPD 0017 class ship (total $0.528M), one (1) MCM 0001 class ship (total $0.039M) and one (1) DDG 0051 Flight IIA class ship (total $0.206M) for a program total of $0.773M.  EEBD replacement fielding will complete in FY2023.
PE costs are calculated for each FY based on the fielding plan distribution and installation level of effort for each FY across the FYDP.
Installation quantities reflect number of SHIPALTS to be performed during each FY.  DSA quantities are not shown.

Same contract for HB007 requirements.  FY19 and prior installation hardware from Marotta, Montville NJ (MOPV) and Dynalec Corp, Sodus NY (FDAS components).  FY20 currently undergoing new contract solicitation.

ImplementationMethodName.val: SHIPALT/DSA:: Installation Name: MAGAZINE SPRINKLING IMPROVEMENT HW

Description.val:
Replaces the detection system designed in the 1960s which has performance deficiencies and is difficult to support and maintain. Replacement includes the Fire Detection and Actuation System (FDAS) and the Motor-Operated Pilot Valves (MOPV). When the FDAS detects a fire, the MOPV opens to provide the sprinkling for the magazine. The FDAS consists of heat detectors, smoke detectors for amphibious ships, and associated controls. MOPV is the same item procured under HB007 - SOPV Replacement. FDAS/MOPV provides increased fire performance and reduced lifecycle and logistics costs.

Procurement costs shown are based on new hardware contract award estimates (HB002/HB007) and actual installation costs from prior years .  Installation costs shown are weighted and will vary based on ship class, ship port location, and installation availability.

Quantities are number of ships.  

Requirement is for all CG 0047, DDG 0051, LHA 0006, LHD 0001, LPD 0017, LSD 0041/0049 ship classes.   

PROCUREMENT: Procurement costs include FDAS and MOPV equipment, shipping, and distribution to ship.  FDAS/MOPV procurement costs can vary significantly by ship class, and quantity and/or size of the magazines. DDG-51 ships already have smoke detectors.
  
INSTALLATION (HB5IN/HB6IN): Funding includes all costs associated with the Fleet Modernization Program Magazine Sprinkling Improvement Design Support Allocation (DSA) and equipment installations onboard ships.  DSA costs are budgeted in the FY prior to equipment procurement.  FDAS/MOPV installation costs can vary significantly by ship class, ship port location, and ship installation availability.
 
FY 2020 procurement costs include one (1) DDG 0051 Flight I class ship (total $0.127M), one (1) DDG 0051 Flight II class ship (total $0.127M), and four (4) DDG 0051 Flight IIA class ships (average $0.236M) for a program total of $1.198M.

FY 2020 installation costs include six (6) FY 2020 procurement hulls ($4.698M) and three (3) DSA for FY 2021 planned installations ($0.600M) for a program total of $5.298M.  FY 2020 installation support services costs include one (1) CONUS DDG 0051 (Flight I) class ship (total $0.553M), one (1) CONUS DDG 0051 Flight II class ship (total $0.553M), and four (4) CONUS DDG 0051 Flight IIA class ships (average $0.898M) for a total of $4.698M.  FY 2020 installation DSA costs include two (2) OCONUS DDG 0051 Flight I class ships (average $0.190M) and one (1) CONUS DDG 0051 Flight II class ship (total $0.220M) for a total of $0.600M.

FY 2021 procurement costs include one (1) DDG 0051 Flight I class ship (total $0.129M) and two (2) DDG 0051 Flight II class ships (average $0.129M) for a program total of $0.388M.

FY 2021 installation costs include three (3) FY 2021 procurement hulls (total $1.855M) and six (6) DSA for FY 2022 planned installations (total $1.326M) for a program total of $3.181M.  FY 2021 installation support services costs include one (1) CONUS DDG 0051 Flight I class ship (total $0.6183M), and two (2) DDG 0051 Flight II class ships (average $0.6183M) for a total of $1.855M.  FY 2021 installation DSA costs include two (2) CONUS DDG 0051 Flight I class ships (average $0.190M), one (1) CONUS DDG 0051 Flight II class ship (total $0.190M), two (2) CONUS DDG 0051 Flight IIA class ships (average $0.238M), and one (1) CONUS LSD 0041 class ship (total $0.280M) for a total of $1.326M.

Name.@footnote: Installation quantities reflect number of SHIPALTS to be performed during each FY.  DSA quantities are not shown.

Same contract provides motor-operated pilot valve requirements under HB002.  FY19 and prior installation hardware from Marotta, Montville NJ (MOPV).  FY20 currently undergoing new contract solicitation.

ImplementationMethodName.val: SHIPALT/DSA:: Installation Name: HB007 - SOPV REPLACEMENT HW

Description.val:
The Solenoid Operated Pilot Valve (SOPV) provides a way for remote control of the Aqueous Film Forming Foam (AFFF) and Countermeasure Wash Down (CMWD) systems. Existing SOPVs are unreliable, costly to repair, and produce the longest downtime for the AFFF system. Top Management Attention/Top Management Initiative (TMA/TMI) and INSURV interest due to impact of this item on AFFF system operation. Replacement of the SOPV with the Motor Operated Pilot Valve (MOPV) is required to ensure these systems are operational for emergencies. MOPV has a 50 year service life and will provide a significant reduction in preventative maintenance and lifecycle cost.

Procurement costs shown are based on new hardware contract award estimates (HB002/HB007) and actual installation costs from prior years.  Installation costs shown are weighted and will vary based on ship class, ship port location, and installation availability.

Quantities are number of ships.  

Requirement is for CG 0047, DDG 0051, LHA 0006, LHD 0001, LPD 0017, LSD 0041/0049 ship classes.

PROCUREMENT:  Costs include SOPV equipment, shipping, and distribution to ship.  SOPV procurement costs vary significantly based on ship class.

INSTALLATION (HB5IN/HB6IN): Funding includes all costs associated with the Fleet Modernization Program SOPV replacement Design Support Allocation (DSA) and equipment installations onboard ships.  DSA costs are budgeted in the FY prior to equipment procurement.  SOPV installation costs vary significantly based on ship class, ship port location, and ship installation availability type.  

FY 2020 procurement costs include one (1) DDG 0051 (Flight II) class ship (total $0.247M), and two (2) DDG 0051 (Flight IIA) class ships (average $0.247M) for a total of $0.741M.

FY 2020 installation costs are for the three (3) FY 2020 procurement hulls ($1.079M) and eight (8) DSA for FY 2021 planned installations ($0.537M) for a program total of $1.616M.  FY 2020 installation costs include one (1) CONUS DDG 0051 Flight II class ship (total $0.360M), and two (2) CONUS DDG 0051 Flight IIA class ships (average $0.360M) for a total of $1.616M.  FY2020 installation DSA costs include two (2) CONUS LSD 0041 class ships (average $0.092), two (2) CONUS DDG 0051 Flight I class ships (average $0.056), one (1) CONUS DDG 0051 Flight II class ship (total $0.056), two (2) CONUS DDG 0051 Flight IIA class ships (average $0.056M), and one (1) OCONUS DDG 0051 Flight IIA class ship (average $0.073M) for a total of $0.537M.

FY 2021 procurement costs include two (2) LSD 0041 class ships (average $0.325), two (2) DDG 0051 Flight I class ships (average $0.154), (1) DDG 0051 Flight II class ship (total $0.189), and (3) DDG 0051 Flight IIA class ships (average $0.189) for a program total of $1.713M.

FY 2021 installation costs include eight (8) FY 2021 procurement hulls (total $4.123M) and five (5) DSA (total $0.277M) in support of the FY22 planned installations for a program total of $4.400M.  FY 2021 installation costs include two (2) CONUS LSD 0041 class ships (average $0.679), two (2) DDG 0051 Flight I class ships (average $0.443), one (1) CONUS DDG 0051 Flight II class ship (total $0.436), and two (2) CONUS DDG 0051 Flight IIA class ships (average $0.436), and one (1) CONUS DDG 0051 ship class (total $0.571M) for a total of $4.123M.  FY2021 installation DSA costs include three (3) CONUS DDG 0051 Flight I (average $0.056M), one (1) OCONUS DDG 0051 Flight I (total $0.056), and one (1) CONUS DDG 0051 Flight IIA (total $0.056M) for a total of $0.277M.

ImplementationMethodName.val: SHIPALT:: Installation Name: HB008 - SCBA REPLACEMENT HW

Description.val:
Self-Contained Breathing Apparatus (SCBA) is a compressed air breathing device compatible with a firefighter's protective wear and helmet, and other damage control equipment. The SCBA are reaching the end of their service life of 15 years and are being replaced with 30 year cylinders. SCBA replacement is required to ensure that ships will deploy with operational safety equipment on-board to provide breathable air while fighting shipboard fires.

Quantities are number of ships.  

Requirement: AFDL 0001, AFDM 0001, CG 0047, DDG 0051 (Flight I,II,IIA), LCC 0019, LCU, LHD 0001, LPD 0017, LSD 0041, LSD 0049, MCM 0001, and PC 0001 ship classes.

PROCUREMENT:  Funding includes the breathing apparatus, 45-minute air cylinders, and 30-minute air cylinders, shipping, distribution to, and modifying stowage on ships.  SCBA procurement costs can vary significantly based on ship class.

INSTALLATION HBINS (HB5IN/HB6IN): Funding includes all costs associated with the Fleet Modernization Program SCBA equipment installations onboard ships. SCBA installation costs can vary significantly based on ship class, ship port location and ship installation availability.

FY 2020 procurement costs include one (1) LHD 0001 class ship (total $1.123M), one (1) LPD 0017 class ship (total $0.915M), two (2) LSD 0041 class ships (average $0.509M), five (5) MCM 0001 class ships (total $0.145M), one (1) AFDL 0001 class ship (total $0.046M), one (1) ARDM 0001 class ship (total $0.067M), two (2) CG 0047 class ships (average $0.292M), one (1) LCC 0019 class ship (total $0.544), and six (6) PC 0001 class ships (average $0.046M) for a program total of $5.294M.

FY 2020 installation costs include one (1) CONUS LHD 0001 class ship (total $0.248M), one (1) OCONUS LPD 0017 class ship (total $0.359M), two (2) CONUS LSD 0041 class ships (average $0.212M), five (5) OCONUS MCM 0001 class ships (total $0.109M), two (2) CONUS CG 0047 class ships (average $0.136M), one (1) OCONUS LCC 0019 class ship (total $0.382) for a program total of $2.230M.  ARDM 0001, AFDL 0001, and PC 0001 ship classes do not have installation costs.
  
FY 2021 procurement costs include six (6) LCU class ships (average $0.024M), two (2) LPD 0017 class ships (average $0.933M), (2) MCM 0001 class ships (average $0.147M), four (4) DDG 0051 Flight IIA class ships (average $0.386M), and three (3) PC 0001 class ships (average $0.047M) for a program total of $3.990M.

FY 2021 installation costs include two (2) CONUS LPD 0017 class ships (average $0.309M), two (2) OCONUS MCM 0001 class ships (average $0.110M), three (3) CONUS DDG 0051 Flight IIA (average $0.159M), one (1) OCONUS DDG 0051 Flight IIA class ship (total $0.205M) for a program total of $1.520M.  LCU and PC 0001 ship classes do not have installation costs.
